job.title: Chiropractic Assistant – X-Ray Certified Preferred
job.description:
Join a well-organized, patient-focused chiropractic office that values precision, teamwork, and calm professionalism.

Key responsibilities
Key Responsibilities
• Schedule patients and manage EMR records
• Assist with therapies and maintain therapeutic equipment
• Verify insurance, handle front-desk intake, and keep daily clinic flow smooth
• Support X-ray imaging if licensed

Qualifications
• Active WA Chiropractic Assistant licence (or application in process)
• X-Ray Technician licence preferred
• Experience with EMR systems and patient-intake procedures

Compensation
$20 – $30 per hour (≈ $40 000 – $60 000 yr) DOE & licensure

job.title: Licensed Massage Therapist – Patient-Focused Wellness Clinic
job.description:
Our Washington-based chiropractic office blends clinical efficiency with holistic care.

Role Summary
Provide therapeutic massages prescribed by the DC, assist with therapy protocols, set up exercise equipment, and help maintain treatment areas.

Qualifications
• Active Washington Massage Therapy License (required)
• Skilled in therapeutic modalities under clinical supervision
• Calm, professional, and team-oriented
• Punctual and open to structured procedures & continuing education

Other Information
• Part-time or full-time schedules available
• Daytime plus occasional evening hours
• Strong office culture with clear communication & respect for work-life balance

Compensation
$30 – $60 per hour (≈ $60 000 – $120 000 yr) DOE

job.title: Associate Chiropractor – High-Engagement Wellness Practice
job.company: Chiropractic Wellness Clinic – Chadds Ford, PA
job.description:
Our clinic thrives on strong patient relationships, consistent results, and a team environment. We integrate functional neurology principles alongside hands-on adjustments and complementary services to improve both structure and function.

Job Description
• Perform tailored chiropractic adjustments based on individual needs
• Collaborate with other providers to enhance patient outcomes
• Guide patients through care plans with clarity and empathy
• Track progress and adapt strategies to ensure optimal results
• Maintain professional, timely, accurate documentation

Qualifications
• Doctor of Chiropractic (DC) and current (or in-process) state license
• Excellent communication and patient education skills
• Strong ethics and commitment to a high standard of care
• Ability to collaborate within a diverse healthcare team
• Background in functional neurology is highly desirable (or strong interest to learn)

Other Information
• Competitive base + performance incentives (realistic range $85K–$100K)
• Benefits: health insurance, malpractice coverage, CEU allowance, advancement tracks
• Modern facility near top schools, amenities, and outdoor recreation
